intro: Saccoloma elegans var. spinosa, commonly known as the spiny saccoloma, is a rare fern species native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Blechnaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated fronds that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its fronds are usually dark green and have a leathery texture, with spines along the margins. The spiny saccoloma is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
